intro: Hippocratea senegalensis var. madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar yellowwood, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically pollinated by insects. It is valued for its hard, durable wood and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
